meta.name: Elastic Specialization Block - Basketball
meta.owner: Austin Lawrence, Director of Performance Systems
meta.codexReference: Exercise Progression Law v1.0.1, Load Standards v2.1.2, Governance v4.0, MDP_COURT_VERTICAL v1.3

block_definition.description: 4-week intensive plyometric block emphasizing vertical/lateral reactive strength for basketball athletes. Operates at upper bounds of legal plyometric volume within OFF_SEASON context.
block_definition.adaptation_target: Reactive strength index (RSI), vertical jump height, lateral force production, repeat-jump capacity
block_definition.season_rationale: High plyometric volume (approaching population ceilings) is only safe and effective during OFF_SEASON when fixture density = 0 and recovery capacity = maximum. All in-season phases have reduced contact allowances.
block_definition.population_rationale: Youth 8-12 lack neuromuscular maturity and structural readiness for sustained high-intensity elastic work. This block operates at 80-100% of population ceilings for extended duration.

entry_requirements.description: Mandatory gates that MUST be passed before athlete can enter block. EPA will validate these before generating week 1.

readiness_gate.rationale: High plyometric volume requires full CNS capacity and tissue health. YELLOW/RED states contraindicate elastic specialization.

season_gate.rationale: Only season with zero fixture density and maximum recovery capacity

landing_quality_score.assessment_method: Coach visual assessment using EFL landing quality rubric (symmetry, sound, posture, control)
landing_quality_score.rationale: Landing quality <7/10 indicates insufficient eccentric control for high-volume elastic work

knee_valgus_status.assessment_method: Single-leg squat, bilateral landing, lateral movement screening
knee_valgus_status.rationale: Any knee valgus present = immediate injury risk under high plyometric volume

ankle_dorsiflexion.rationale: Insufficient ankle mobility creates compensatory landing patterns under elastic load
ankle_dorsiflexion.enforcement: SOFT_GATE (warn if <35°, allow with mobility supplementation)

single_leg_squat_quality.rationale: Unilateral control prerequisite for safe lateral and unilateral plyometric work
single_leg_squat_quality.enforcement: HARD_GATE for weeks 2-4, SOFT_GATE for week 1

plyo_exposure_weeks.rationale: Athlete must have completed minimum 8 weeks of foundational plyometric work (E1-E2 emphasis) before specialization block

landing_progression_complete.definition: Athlete has progressed through Levels 1-2 of vertical jump progression (Exercise Progression Law reference) with excellent landing quality

bilateral_jump_demonstration.quality_standard: Quiet, symmetrical landings with no valgus

absolute: Active lower limb injury (ACL, meniscus, ankle sprain, patellar tendinopathy, Achilles tendinopathy)
Any fracture or stress fracture within 6 months
Growth plate pain or Osgood-Schlatter flare
contraindications.enforcement: Absolute contraindications = HARD_GATE, Relative = SOFT_GATE with monitoring

weekly_structure.description: Progressive 4-week emphasis cycle with deload week 4

week_1.primary_adaptation: Vertical reactive strength, stiffness, rapid force production

e_node_distribution.E2: 40-50% of contacts (moderate elastic, box jumps, low hurdles)
e_node_distribution.E3: 10-20% of contacts (reactive, depth jumps low height)
e_node_distribution.E4: 0-10% of contacts (advanced athletes only, Director approval)

exercises.note: Tier 3 work, 12 contacts = 14% of session (within 40% cap)

week_2.primary_adaptation: Horizontal force production, bounding capacity, acceleration out of elasticity

Youth_13_17.note: Week 2 maintains same volume as week 1, changes emphasis only

exercises.note: First exposure to lateral elastic loading

session_totals.note: Week 2 emphasizes E2 volume consolidation before week 3 reactive work

week_3.primary_adaptation: True reactive strength (minimal ground contact), lateral reactive capacity, multi-directional elasticity

Youth_13_17.note: Week 3 maintains volume but increases intensity (more E3, more reactivity)

intensity_management.rationale: Week 3 is highest CNS demand week of block. Volume stays constant but intensity increases via e-node and reactivity progression.
monitoring_required: Jump height testing (any decrement >10% = reduce intensity)

regression_protocol.if_tendon_irritation: Reduce contacts by 30%, eliminate E3/E4 work
regression_protocol.if_readiness_yellow: Convert to week 2 emphasis (horizontal E2 focus)

exercises: Pogo Jumps 3×8 (24 contacts, reduced for CNS management)

exercises.note: Tier 2 volume work after Tier 3 intensity

session_totals.note: This is peak intensity session of entire block - requires GREEN readiness and perfect landing quality

week_4.primary_adaptation: Tissue restoration, supercompensation window, performance assessment
week_4.purpose: Reduce training stress by 40-50% while maintaining movement quality. Allow tissues to adapt to weeks 1-3 loading. Assess performance improvements.

Youth_13_17.note: Significant volume reduction with maintained quality

exercise_selection_rules.intensity_management: Low-moderate intensity, high movement quality focus

assessments.method: Drop jump from 30cm box, calculate jump height / contact time
Coach visual scoring on bilateral and unilateral landings
10 continuous vertical jumps, compare jump 1 vs jump 10 height

exercises.note: Return to stick landing emphasis for quality restoration

session_totals.note: 45% volume reduction from week 3, zero Tier 3 work

exit_criteria.description: Mandatory performance and health checks before transitioning out of block
exit_criteria.enforcement: EPA will not generate post-block programming until exit criteria validated

vertical_jump_improvement.rationale: Primary adaptation target - must see measurable vertical jump improvement

reactive_strength_index.rationale: RSI reflects elastic efficiency - central to block goals

repeat_jump_capacity.test: 10 continuous vertical jumps, height decrement analysis
repeat_jump_capacity.rationale: Ensures elastic capacity maintained under fatigue (basketball game demand)

landing_quality_maintained.test: Coach visual assessment (bilateral and unilateral landings)
landing_quality_maintained.pass_threshold: Landing quality ≥7/10 AND no worse than block entry
landing_quality_maintained.rationale: Quality must be maintained or improved despite high volume weeks

knee_valgus_absent.test: Visual screening on landings and direction changes
knee_valgus_absent.pass_threshold: Zero valgus present on all movement screens
knee_valgus_absent.rationale: Any valgus emergence = block failed, must regress to corrective work

no_tendon_irritation.test: Patellar, Achilles, plantar fascia palpation + functional testing
no_tendon_irritation.pass_threshold: No pain on palpation, no pain during jumping
no_tendon_irritation.rationale: Tendon irritation = block volume exceeded tissue capacity

no_knee_pain.pass_threshold: No pain during or after training

minimum_green_weeks.definition: Athlete maintained GREEN readiness for at least 3 of 4 weeks
minimum_green_weeks.rationale: If athlete dropped to YELLOW/RED frequently, volume was too high
minimum_green_weeks.enforcement: SOFT_GATE (warn if <3 weeks GREEN, but allow exit if performance criteria met)

SUCCESSFUL_COMPLETION.criteria: All performance + movement quality + tissue health criteria passed
SUCCESSFUL_COMPLETION.next_block_recommendation: Return to MDP_COURT_VERTICAL baseline programming OR Power Transfer Block (Zone 2 emphasis)

PARTIAL_SUCCESS.criteria: Performance improved BUT movement quality degraded OR tissue health issue emerged
PARTIAL_SUCCESS.action: Require 1-week recovery protocol before next block
PARTIAL_SUCCESS.corrective_focus: Address limiting factor (landing quality correction, tendon health protocol)

FAILED_BLOCK.criteria: No performance improvement OR movement quality significantly degraded OR tissue health issue
FAILED_BLOCK.action: TERMINATE specialization approach, return to foundational work (Levels 1-2 from Exercise Progression Law)
FAILED_BLOCK.investigation_required: Identify why block failed (volume too high, inadequate prerequisites, insufficient recovery)

transition_protocol.description: How to safely exit block and return to baseline programming

activity_during_recovery: Walking, swimming, or other low-impact activity
post_block_recovery.rationale: Tissues need 3-7 days to complete adaptation response from high-volume block

week_3_post_block.note: Athlete is now back to baseline programming

next_block_timing.rationale: Cannot run consecutive specialization blocks without baseline programming buffer. Tissues need extended recovery and rebalancing.
next_block_timing.violation_consequence: Running specialization blocks back-to-back = guaranteed overuse injury

monitoring_requirements.description: What must be tracked throughout block to ensure safety

readiness_assessment.action_if_yellow: Reduce volume by 20%, eliminate Tier 3 work
readiness_assessment.action_if_red: Skip session or convert to Zone 8 (mobility/skill)

movement_quality_spot_check.action_if_degraded: Reduce e-node intensity by 1 level for entire session

landing_sound.action_if_loud: Pause set, provide landing cues, reduce height/distance if persists

knee_valgus_watch.action_if_present: IMMEDIATE stop, regress to bilateral E1 work, do not progress until corrected

jump_height_tracking.monitor: Relative jump height across sets (visual or measured)
jump_height_tracking.action_if_decrement: If height drops >15% within session, terminate plyometric work

tendon_palpation.locations: Patellar tendon, Achilles tendon, plantar fascia
tendon_palpation.action_if_tender: Ice, reduce volume next session by 30%

joint_pain_query.method: Ask athlete: any knee, ankle, or hip pain?
joint_pain_query.action_if_yes: Investigate source, may require session off or medical evaluation

jump_test.action_if_decrement: If week-to-week jump height decreases >10%, reduce weekly volume by 20%

readiness_trend.action_if_declining: If readiness trending down across 2 weeks, extend recovery days between sessions

coach_guidance.description: Coaching notes for implementing this block
when_to_use_this_block: Athlete has completed 8+ weeks of foundational plyo work
Vertical jump or reactive strength is identified limiter
OFF_SEASON with no competitions for next 6 weeks
when_NOT_to_use_this_block: Any in-season phase (use maintenance programming instead)
Athlete has active injury or recent injury (<8 weeks)
Athlete has <8 weeks prior plyometric training
common_mistakes_to_avoid: Adding volume beyond population ceilings (Youth 13-17 max 120/session, Adult max 140/session)
Skipping deload week 4 (attempting to maintain volume)
Running block during season (use only in OFF_SEASON)
Running consecutive specialization blocks without 8+ week buffer

epa_integration_specifications.description: How EPA must use this block during session generation

pre_generation_validation.step_1: Validate all entry_requirements before generating week 1
pre_generation_validation.step_5: Load athlete's current movement quality scores
pre_generation_validation.step_6: IF any entry requirement fails → REJECT block, provide reason code + legal alternative

weekly_generation_logic.week_1: Use week_1.exercise_selection_rules to filter AETHER exercises, generate 3 sessions targeting vertical patterns, validate contacts within range
weekly_generation_logic.week_2: Use week_2.exercise_selection_rules, shift to horizontal patterns, maintain same volume
weekly_generation_logic.week_3: Use week_3.exercise_selection_rules, increase E3 percentage (up to Tier 3 cap), monitor closely
weekly_generation_logic.week_4: Use week_4.exercise_selection_rules, reduce volume by 40%, shift to E1-E2 emphasis, include assessments

exercise_filtering_per_week.method: Apply e_node_distribution percentages as filters on AETHER library
exercise_filtering_per_week.example_week_1: If session needs 86 contacts and e_node_distribution says E2=40-50%, select exercises totaling 34-43 E2 contacts
exercise_filtering_per_week.enforcement: Weekly e_node distribution is SOFT target, session-level Tier 3 cap is HARD enforcement

session_validation_gates.gate_4: All exercises pass Exercise Progression Law validation
session_validation_gates.gate_5: Readiness = GREEN (hard requirement for all sessions)
session_validation_gates.output_if_fail: REJECTED with reason_code, legal alternative provided

post_block_validation.requirement: EPA must validate exit_criteria before generating post-block programming
post_block_validation.if_exit_criteria_failed: ESCALATE to coach for manual review and corrective programming

integration_with_exercise_progression_la.description: How this block applies Exercise Progression Law v1.0.1

week_1_applies.load_band: Band_0 to Band_1 (bodyweight to light load)

week_3_progression.axes_progressed: e_node_difficulty (increased E3 percentage) + reactivity_level (increased Reactive_Minimal_Contact percentage)
week_3_progression.justification: Week 3 is NOT a single-session progression - it is a weekly emphasis shift within earned progression. Athletes have consolidated E3 work at lower percentages in weeks 1-2. This is legal within block structure.
week_3_progression.note: If this were single-session athlete progression, two-axis change would be illegal. Within 4-week block structure with weekly emphases, this is acceptable.

week_4_regression.axes_regressed: e_node_difficulty (reduced E3, increased E1) + reactivity_level (reduced Reactive, increased Stick/Continuous)
week_4_regression.purpose: Deload week intentionally regresses multiple axes to create recovery stimulus
